metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3183 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The chunked transfer coding implementation in the Apache HTTP Server before2.4.14 does not properly parse chunk headers, which allows remote attackersto conduct HTTP request smuggling attacks via a crafted request, related tomishandling of large chunk-size values and invalid chunk-extensioncharacters in modules/http/http_filters.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.5').
